page.title: 09The Village Hall - Carlton
page.content: Carlton Village Hall was built in l956 and opened by Baroness Beaumont, the mother of the Duke of Norfolk.The main area is the hall,with a stage,kitchen and bar.The fund raising events have altered over the years.At first there were Whist Drives,Old Tyme dancing, Drama group and Jumble sales.Now the hall is hired for Discos,Bingo and Weddings,Birthdays and Engagement parties although it is still used for jumble sales.The Village Hall is not run for profit-all the money goes into running costs.This is difficult due to inflation.The current cost is Â£5/hour plus an extra Â£lO for the bar.All work is voluntary.Only the caretaker is paid.The Play-School hire the hall 3 times a week at reduced rates and the Senior Citizens are given the hall free on Tuesdays.
